content:
I completely agree! Sharing your personal reflections and experiences can be a powerful way to illustrate the practical applications of forgiveness and gratitude. It can help attendees see that these concepts are not just abstract ideas, but tangible tools that can be used to improve our well-being and relationships.

By sharing your own struggles and challenges, you can create a sense of authenticity and vulnerability, which can be incredibly powerful in building trust and connection with the attendees. It's also a great way to show that forgiveness and gratitude are not always easy, but that they are worth the effort.

Remember to keep your sharing concise and focused on the lessons learned, and to use "I" statements to express your thoughts and feelings. This will help you stay authentic and vulnerable, while also being respectful of the group's time and energy.

I think you're on the right track, and I'm excited to see how your workshop unfolds!
